description:
Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones is a tactical role-playing game developed by
Intelligent Systems, and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy Advance
handheld video game console in 2004 for Japan and 2005 in the West. It is
the eighth entry in the Fire Emblem series, the second to be released
outside Japan, and the third and final title to be developed for the Game
Boy Advance after The Binding Blade and its prequel Fire Emblem.

Build an army. Trust no one.

fe8-0.4.0.description:
Requires Archipelago >= 0.6.0

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `custom_worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Changelog:
- Death Link is here!
- Added options for growth randomization and music randomization
- Finally moved to APProcedurePatch, hosts rejoice!
- Tower of Valni floors are no longer gated by main story progression. This means that the `Valni` goal can be achieved after clearing Chapter 8
- Enabled saving in the Tower of Valni/Lagdou Ruins
- Added option to normalize male/female class bases
- Added option to allow all classes to use lockpicks and/or Rogue picks
- Stat labels now change color based on the growth of the stat
- BUGFIX: Fixed a bug that caused Seth and Valter's cutscene battle during the prologue to freeze
- BUGFIX: Units that join at different levels on different routes will now join at the correct level if that level is above the level cap
- BUGFIX: All Summoners and Necromancers can now summon phantoms
- BUGFIX: Fixed several logic bugs leading to generation crashes

Changed from 0.4.0-rc4:
- Changed how character promo gains for classes that didn't already have them worked

Known issues:
- Chapters with lots of enemies on-screen at once can have visual glitches if there are too many unique classes. This is most commonly-experienced in chapter 19.
- Attempting to set `MinimumUsableHolyWeapons` to 6 or higher may cause seed generation to fail due to being unable to place enough progressive weapon ranks.
- Units that gain "overflow" exp over the level cap will show that EXP on the status page. This is a visual glitch only.
- In some cases, enemies on otherwise-impassable terrain will be unable to move. If this occurs in a rout mission, this may require excessive RNG manipulation to clear.
- Player units will use generic palettes.
- In chapter 9 Ephraim, enemies are programmed to ignore Tana, but may move towards her anyway.
- The Universal Tracker may report unintuitive unlocks.
- All Summoners other than Ewan and Knoll share a summon "slot", meaning only one Summoner may have a phantom on the field at once.
fe8-0.4.0.title: Archipelago fe8-0.4.0

Requires Archipelago >= 0.6.0

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `custom_worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

- All Summoners other than Ewan and Knoll share a summon "slot", meaning only one Summoner may have a phantom on the field at once.

fe8-alpha-0.0.1.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.2

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.
fe8-alpha-0.0.1.title: FE8 Archipelago alpha 0.0.1

fe8-alpha-0.0.2.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.2

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Known issues:
- Chapters with lots of enemies on-screen at once can have visual glitches if there are too many unique classes. This is most commonly-experienced in chapter 19.
- Skirmishes are buggy and, in the worst cases, may crash the game if an enemy with a cutscene-only class is loaded.
- Attempting to set `MinimumUsableHolyWeapons` to 6 or higher may cause seed generation to fail due to being unable to place enough progressive weapon ranks.
- Units that gain "overflow" exp over the level cap will show that EXP on the status page. This should be a visual glitch only.
- In some cases, enemies on otherwise-impassable terrain will be unable to move. If this occurs in a rout mission, this may require excessive RNG manipulation to clear.
- Status effects will get randomly cleared after combat.
- Monster classes with unique weapons (Revenants, Baels, etc) are not randomized, nor are they available for randomization
- Player units will use generic palettes.
fe8-alpha-0.0.2.title: FE8 Archipelago alpha 0.0.2

fe8-alpha-0.1.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.2

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Known issues:
- Chapters with lots of enemies on-screen at once can have visual glitches if there are too many unique classes. This is most commonly-experienced in chapter 19.
- Attempting to set `MinimumUsableHolyWeapons` to 6 or higher may cause seed generation to fail due to being unable to place enough progressive weapon ranks.
- Units that gain "overflow" exp over the level cap will show that EXP on the status page. This is a visual glitch only.
- In some cases, enemies on otherwise-impassable terrain will be unable to move. If this occurs in a rout mission, this may require excessive RNG manipulation to clear.
- Monster classes with unique weapons (Revenants, Baels, etc) are not randomized, nor are they available for randomization.
- Player units will use generic palettes.
- In chapter 9 Ephraim, enemies are programmed to ignore Tana, but may move towards her anyway.
- In rare cases, seed generation may fail with an impossible class combination. If this happens, please send a bug report with the seed number.
fe8-alpha-0.1.0.title: FE8 Archipelago alpha 0.1.0

fe8-alpha-0.2.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.3

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Changelog:
- Ported the client to the generic Bizhawk client. **The old FE8 client will no longer work with this build.**
- Fixed a bug where the modified lord weapon locks were not working correctly.
- Fixed a bug with the sleep graphic

Known issues:
- Chapters with lots of enemies on-screen at once can have visual glitches if there are too many unique classes. This is most commonly-experienced in chapter 19.
- Attempting to set `MinimumUsableHolyWeapons` to 6 or higher may cause seed generation to fail due to being unable to place enough progressive weapon ranks.
- Units that gain "overflow" exp over the level cap will show that EXP on the status page. This is a visual glitch only.
- In some cases, enemies on otherwise-impassable terrain will be unable to move. If this occurs in a rout mission, this may require excessive RNG manipulation to clear.
- Monster classes with unique weapons (Revenants, Baels, etc) are not randomized, nor are they available for randomization.
- Player units will use generic palettes.
- In chapter 9 Ephraim, enemies are programmed to ignore Tana, but may move towards her anyway.
- In rare cases, seed generation may fail with an impossible class combination. If this happens, please send a bug report with the seed number.
fe8-alpha-0.2.0.title: FE8 Archipelago alpha 0.2.0

fe8-alpha-0.3.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.4

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Changelog:
- Added monsters to the randomization pool, along with several options relating to them.
- Added new `Goal` options: Tirado% (clear chapter 8), Valni% (clear Tower of Valni floor 8) and Lagdou% (clear Lagdou Ruins floor 10).
- Disabled Easy Mode.
- Fixed an error where world generation would produce a mismatched number of items and locations.
- Fixed a race conditions where items received while on the world map could be lost if the save was reloaded.
- Fixed several smaller display issues.

Known issues:
- Chapters with lots of enemies on-screen at once can have visual glitches if there are too many unique classes. This is most commonly-experienced in chapter 19.
- Attempting to set `MinimumUsableHolyWeapons` to 6 or higher may cause seed generation to fail due to being unable to place enough progressive weapon ranks.
- Units that gain "overflow" exp over the level cap will show that EXP on the status page. This is a visual glitch only.
- In some cases, enemies on otherwise-impassable terrain will be unable to move. If this occurs in a rout mission, this may require excessive RNG manipulation to clear.
- Player units will use generic palettes.
- In chapter 9 Ephraim, enemies are programmed to ignore Tana, but may move towards her anyway.
- The Universal Tracker does not seem to recognize whether logic considers the post-chapter 8 section beatable.
fe8-alpha-0.3.0.title: FE8 Archipelago alpha 0.3.0

fe8-alpha-0.3.0-rc1.description:
**This release is untested. To use the stable release, use 0.2.0**

Requires Archipelago 0.4.4

Drop fe8.apworld into your Archipelago install in /lib/worlds. To open patch files, drag. the .apfe8 file onto the ArchipelagoLauncher.exe file.
fe8-alpha-0.3.0-rc1.title: FE8 Archipelago alpha 0.3.0-rc1 (UNSTABLE)

fe8-alpha-0.3.1.description:
Requires Archipelago >= 0.4.4

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Changelog:
- Fixed error with initialization caused by an invalid ROM name
- Fixed error with generation caused by a mismatch in region naming

Known issues:
- Chapters with lots of enemies on-screen at once can have visual glitches if there are too many unique classes. This is most commonly-experienced in chapter 19.
- Attempting to set `MinimumUsableHolyWeapons` to 6 or higher may cause seed generation to fail due to being unable to place enough progressive weapon ranks.
- Units that gain "overflow" exp over the level cap will show that EXP on the status page. This is a visual glitch only.
- In some cases, enemies on otherwise-impassable terrain will be unable to move. If this occurs in a rout mission, this may require excessive RNG manipulation to clear.
- Player units will use generic palettes.
- In chapter 9 Ephraim, enemies are programmed to ignore Tana, but may move towards her anyway.
- The Universal Tracker does not seem to recognize whether logic considers the post-chapter 8 section beatable.
- Generation with monsters may fail due to logic bugs.
fe8-alpha-0.3.1.title: fe8-alpha-0.3.1

Changelog:
- Fixed error with duplicate locations with smooth level caps disabled

Known issues:

- Player units will use generic palettes.
- In chapter 9 Ephraim, enemies are programmed to ignore Tana, but may move towards her anyway.

fe8-alpha-0.4.0-rc2.description:
**This release is currently undergoing testing. To use the stable release, use 0.3.2**

Requires Archipelago >= 0.6.0

Drop `fe8.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `custom_worlds`. To open patch files, drag. the `.apfe8` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Changelog:
- Death Link is here!
- Added options for growth randomization and music randomization
- Finally moved to APProcedurePatch, hosts rejoice!
- Tower of Valni floors are no longer gated by main story progression. This means that the `Valni` goal can be achieved after clearing Chapter 8

- BUGFIX: All Summoners and Necromancers can now summon phantoms
- BUGFIX: Fixed several logic bugs leading to generation crashes

Changed from 0.4.0-rc1:
- Added additional checks to hopefully prevent spurious Death Links
- Fixed a crash with status effect icons.

Known issues:
- Chapters with lots of enemies on-screen at once can have visual glitches if there are too many unique classes. This is most commonly-experienced in chapter 19.
- Attempting to set `MinimumUsableHolyWeapons` to 6 or higher may cause seed generation to fail due to being unable to place enough progressive weapon ranks.
- Units that gain "overflow" exp over the level cap will show that EXP on the status page. This is a visual glitch only.
- In some cases, enemies on otherwise-impassable terrain will be unable to move. If this occurs in a rout mission, this may require excessive RNG manipulation to clear.
- Player units will use generic palettes.
- In chapter 9 Ephraim, enemies are programmed to ignore Tana, but may move towards her anyway.
- The Universal Tracker may report unintuitive unlocks.
- All Summoners other than Ewan and Knoll share a summon "slot", meaning only one Summoner may have a phantom on the field at once.
